summary: The term ecosystem traditionally focuses on interactions among living organisms within specific geographic locations and times, influenced by various biotic and abiotic factors. Today, it metaphorically describes human organizations that embrace organic, decentralized structures across various spaces and times, leading to the emergence of Ecosystem Architecture.
excerpt: Ecosystems traditionally involve biotic and abiotic interactions within a geographic space and time. Modern usage transcends this, describing decentralized human organizations that require new models and skills.
